# C++: Display the Sum of Three Integers

This program goes for massive overkill, implementing addition on arbitrary
precision signed decimal integers stored as strings.  Because of course I did.

Example input and output:

```
Enter first integer:   
Enter second integer: - 
Enter third integer:   
Sum:  
```

Original: [How can I write a C++ program to display the sum of three integers?](https://www.quora.com/How-can-I-write-a-C-program-to-display-the-sum-of-three-integers/answer/Joe-Zbiciak)

## Bonus: Sum of Five Integers

I referred back to this answer for a different question that wanted the sum of
five integers.  I just wrote a new `main()` function:

```
int main() {
  auto i1 = GetInteger("Enter first integer:  ", std::cin, std::cout);
  auto i2 = GetInteger("Enter second integer: ", std::cin, std::cout);
  auto i3 = GetInteger("Enter third integer:  ", std::cin, std::cout);
  auto i4 = GetInteger("Enter fourth integer: ", std::cin, std::cout);
  auto i5 = GetInteger("Enter fifth integer:  ", std::cin, std::cout);

  const auto s12 = AddIntegers(i1, i2);
  const auto s123 = AddIntegers(s12, i3);
  const auto s1234 = AddIntegers(s123, i4);
  const auto s12345 = AddIntegers(s1234, i5);

  std::cout << "Sum: " << s12345 << '\n';
}
```
